text: Elsie Quarterman (November 28, 1910 â€“ June 9, 2014) was an American plant ecologist. She was a Professor Emerita at Vanderbilt University. She is known for her work on the ecology of Tennessee cedar glades. Quarterman was born on November 28, 1910 in Valdosta, Georgia. She earned a B.A. from Georgia State Women's College (now Valdosta State University) in 1932 and earned an M.A. in botany from Duke University in 1943. She died on June 9, 2014, at the age of 103. ==Related pages== *List of ecologists ==References== Category:1910 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Academics from Tennessee Category:American centenarians Category:American ecologists Category:Scientists from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Valdosta, Georgia
title: Elsie Quarterman
